intro: Spergularia modesta proles urbica, commonly known as the urban sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in disturbed soils, such as those found in urban environments. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers with five petals, and its leaves are usually opposite and lance-shaped. It has a fibrous root system that helps it anchor in sandy or gravelly substrates. This species is often found in gardens, roadsides, and other human-altered habitats.
